title: How to Catch Giratina in Pokémon Pearl or Diamond

steps.title: Fill up your Pokédex, then get a National Pokédex from Professor Rowan.
steps.content: Fill up your Pokédex, then get a National Pokédex from Professor Rowan.

steps.title: Make sure that you have access to Route 214.
steps.content: Make sure that you have access to Route 214.

steps.title: Buy Dusk Balls, Timer Balls, Quick Balls, and Ultra Balls or use the ones you already have.
steps.content: Buy Dusk Balls, Timer Balls, Quick Balls, and Ultra Balls or use the ones you already have. Bring your Master Ball if you have one. Have high level Pokémon that are at least level 50 or higher. You'll be in a cave, so Dusk Balls are very good balls to use to catch Giratina. Ultra Balls work well, too.

steps.title: Have Pokémon that know the moves Rock Smash, Surf, Rock Climb, and Defog.
steps.content: Have Pokémon that know the moves Rock Smash, Surf, Rock Climb, and Defog. A good Pokémon to use is a normal/flying Pokémon like Staraptor because Giratina's offensive moves (apart from Slash) won't hurt it. This comes in use because Giratina's move (Shadow Force) is also very powerful.

steps.title: Search the route for a passage called Spring Path.
steps.content: Search the route for a passage called Spring Path. You will only be able to access this path after you receive the National Pokédex.

steps.title: Follow the passage to Sendoff Spring.
steps.content: Follow the passage to Sendoff Spring.

steps.title: Make your way through the grass, you will find a wall you can climb up using Rock Climb.
steps.content: Make your way through the grass, you will find a wall you can climb up using Rock Climb. Go around in a circle through the grass until you find a wall you can climb down with Rock Climb. Enter the cave at the bottom of the wall.

steps.title: Enter the cave called Turnback Cave.
steps.content: Enter the cave called Turnback Cave. It is called this because once you enter a room from another, if you come back the way you came, you won't end up in the same room you came from. It can be very confusing as it is a maze. You need to find your way past three pillars in the cave before you go through thirty rooms. If you encounter a pillar, it will tell you how many pillars you've passed (the number on the top) and the number of rooms you have been through (the number on the bottom.) Thirty rooms is a lot to go through and many people make it past three pillars and to Giratina before reaching that.

steps.title: Once you pass the third pillar, you can go through any door.
steps.content: Once you pass the third pillar, you can go through any door. It will automatically lead you to Giratina. Giratina will be standing there in a mighty way. Talk to it. The battle will ensue.

steps.title: Get its health down as much as you possibly can.
steps.content: Get its health down as much as you possibly can. It can be in the yellow, but getting it in the red is recommended. Try not to faint it. Ice, Ghost, Dragon and Dark type moves are very effective. Use Fire, Water, Electric, Bug, Grass and Poison type moves to get the health down slowly so you won't make Giratina faint.

steps.title: Once it's considerably weakened, you can either put it to sleep or you can just start throwing balls at it.
steps.content: Once it's considerably weakened, you can either put it to sleep or you can just start throwing balls at it. If you run out of Poké Balls, get defeated or faint it, reset. In case you don't know the drill, always save before attempting to catch a very rare Pokémon if you can (which you can with Giratina before talking to it).

steps.title: You did it!
steps.content: You did it! Once you have caught Giratina, give yourself a pat on the back for it.
